product_name: MuradSuperactive Mattifying Oil + Pore Control Moisturizer SPF 50
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeHSA/FSA eligibleMurad's Mattifying Oil + Pore Control Moisturizer SPF 50 delivers shine-free hydration as salicylic acid smooths texture & minimizes pores with SPF 50 protection
details: DetailsBenefitsSupercharged 3-in-1 moisturizer smooths and softens skin while minimizing the appearance of poresControls shine and blurs imperfections for a smooth, polished look that lasts all dayHigh-level, ultra-sheer SPF 50 with no white castLayers well under makeupKey IngredientsPrecision-delivery salicylic acid blend: gently smooths texture and minimizes the look of poresOil-trapping microspheres: mattify, smooth, and blur imperfections all dayUltra-sheer SPF 50: helps prevent premature aging from UVA/UVB damageResearch ResultsHelps keep skin matte and controls shine all day*Smooths skin texture and minimizes the look of pores100% agreed product does not leave a white cast*Non-comedogenic*2-week consumer perception study on 35 participants, Fitzpatrick II-IVItem 2635510How To UseTo Use: AM. Apply liberally over face, neck, and chest.For external use only. Avoid contact with eyes. Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.IngredientsActive: Avobenzone 3.0%, Homosalate 7.0%, Octisalate 5.0%, Octocrylene 7.5%. Inactive: Water (Aqua), Tapioca Starch, Polysilicone-11, Propanediol, Butyloctyl Salicylate, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Propanediol Dicaprylate, Amylopectin, Coconut Alkanes, Cetearyl Alcohol, PEG-100 Stearate, Glyceryl Stearate, Butyl Avocadate, Capryloyl Salicylic Acid, Coco-Glucoside, Urea, Yeast Amino Acids, Trehalose, Inositol, Taurine, Betaine, Persea Gratissima (Avocado) Oil, Xylitylglucoside, Anhydroxylitol, Bisabolol, Allantoin, Amylose, Xylitol, Zinc Gluconate, Aminomethyl Propanol, Hydrogenated Vegetable Oil, Tocopherol, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer-6, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Ethylhexylglycerin, Xanthan Gum, Laureth-12, Cellulose, Cellulose Gum, Tetrasodium Glutamate Diacetate, Citric Acid, Glucose, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin, Sodium Benzoate, Potassium Sorbate, Citrus Aurantium Peel Oil, Limonene, Linalool, Dimethyl Phenethyl Acetate, Linalyl Acetate, Citral, Pinene, Fragrance (Parfum), Iron Oxides (CI 77492)/Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: To Use: AM. Apply liberally over face, neck, and chest.For external use only. Avoid contact with eyes. Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.

reviews.headline: oily
reviews.comments: bring back the old formula without the Moisturizer. this is not matte at all.

reviews.headline: High SPF
reviews.comments: At my dermatologist's suggestion, I started looking for a daily face sunscreen that had a higher SPF than 30. After some failed attempts with just sunscreen products, I decided to try this moisturizer + sunscreen. I'm very happy with the purchase! I can tell the difference in the increased SPF protection, and also feel that my face is staying hydrated. I have really oily skin and, for me, this product provides good oil control and a mattifying effect. It smells lightly of sunscreen, but it dissapates quickly once absorbed. The only con, hence the loss of one star, is that the consistency is a little thick and tacky, so it pulls on my skin quite a bit when applying, which I don't appreciate. But it is not a deal breaker for me at this point. Otherwise, a good option for increased daily face protection.

reviews.headline: Moisturizer SPF 50
reviews.comments: This moisturizer is great, it feels very hydrating and smooth free applying on my face. I also love that it has an SPF 50. In my opinion it doesn't leave a white sheer color on my face when applying on my face. I also wear this everyday no matter what the weather is and before applying my makeup.

reviews.headline: Not it for me
reviews.comments: I don't know how I feel about this product. It felt like this wasn't really a mattifying product. This also felt so heavy on my skin and just felt like it weighed down on my face. I also could just smell that whole sunscreen smell. The packaging is pretty nice and dispenses the product well. I just can't use a lot of this product on my face.

reviews.headline: Best sunscreen I've found
reviews.comments: My skin is oily and acne prone, and this sunscreen helps with that! It does dry mate specially with this Texas heat, also a very big plus for me is that it doesn't burn or irritate my eyes! I know it's on the pricier side but it's definitely worth the price.

reviews.headline: Couldn't possibly make my face shinier!
reviews.comments: The old formula was great, perfectly mattifying. This formula makes my face look like I dunked it in a bucket of canola oil.

reviews.headline: Not good for acne prone skin!
reviews.comments: I had originally bought this sunscreen to be rid of white cast but after use overtime, my skin began to break out. I would not recommend if you have acne.

reviews.headline: It's good but liked old formula better
reviews.comments: Like it but doesn't blend as well as old formula, plus don't want salicylic acid everyday.

reviews.headline: Citrus sunscreen
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] It feels more like a soft, lightweight primer than a heavy sunscreen, which surprised me in a good way. When I apply it, it goes on smoothly, absorbs quickly, and gives my skin a nice matte finish without feeling dry or tight. I have combination skin, and this does a great job keeping the shine away throughout the day, especially in my T-zone area. My pores look more blurred when I wear it, and I notice my makeup applies better on top of it too. The scent in my opinion is subtle, but it's there. It smells clean and slightly herbal, kind of like a soft citrus and tea tree blend, but it fades quickly once it's on my skin. I like it, it makes the application feel more refreshing without being overpowering or like a strong perfume fragrance. The sunscreen didn't irritate my skin at all, which is always a plus for me with scented products. On really hot and humid days, I did notice a bit of shine peeking through by the afternoon, but nothing too bad and I still feel like my skin looks smoother than usual.

reviews.headline: Matte for the win!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I love that this sunscreen has a matte finish. The fact that it includes actives as well is also a plus. The packaging is small and somewhat pricey but definitely worth it. The texture is a bit thicker as well just an FYI.

reviews.headline: I wanted to love this
reviews.comments: I tried this product multiple times and it left my face like an oil slick!!! My goal is to find a sunscreen that won't leave my very oily skin more oily!!!

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: This was my first time buying a high end moisturizer. I wanted to find something with SPF that would keep my face from becoming too oily, so I had high hopes for this one. When you first put it on it's matte, but then I noticed shine coming through an hour later. By lunchtime I was an oil slick (and my job is in an air conditioned office!) The only pro is the SPF did work, but I feel like that's the bare minimum of what this product should do. I'll probably still use it up, but I won't be buying again.

reviews.headline: Great spf!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I loved this sunscreen! It was so smooth and felt amazing on my skin. I really like how it wasn't overly scented and the pump made it so easy to use. I didn't feel greasy either which I really appreciated!

reviews.headline: Great spf!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I loved this sunscreen! It was so smooth and felt amazing on my skin. I really like how it wasn't overly scented and the pump made it so easy to use. I didn't feel greasy either which I really appreciated!

reviews.headline: Absolutely Love It!
reviews.comments: I've been using the previous version of this for years, and am pleasantly surprised by the update in SPF & packaging.

reviews.headline: All in one for summer
reviews.comments: I recently tried the Murad Superactive Moisturizer SPF 50 Mattifying Oil + Pore Control, and I'm really loving it! The salicylic acid has smoothed my skin and minimized pores, while the oil trapping microspheres keep me shine free all day. Plus, the SPF 50 is a bonus it layers perfectly under makeup without leaving a white cast. It's lightweight and doesn't clog my pores. Definitely a keeper in my skincare routine!

reviews.headline: Murad SPH 50 Pore Sunscreen
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] Murad has been in my skin care rotation for years. This SPH works great for both a smoothe SPH and as a moisturizer. I've noticed significantly less tanning effects on my face this year. Highly effective. 5 stars.

reviews.headline: One of my new skincare products to my collection
reviews.comments: I received this product in exchange for my honest review. One new favorite to my skincare collection! Love how my skin feels with this SPF moisturizer. It makes my oily skin feel and look less oily and my pores less noticeable. It does what is says it does. It goes on so smooth under my makeup and last all day. I would say it helps my makeup stay longer. The scent is like lemons and it makes me feel my face smell fresh and clean. The pump dispenser is a huge plus as per I like more clean and sanitary products. It is on the budget friendly is you think about how long it last. A pea size is all you need and that will help get your face  protected and looking good. I recommend to friends and family.

reviews.headline: Oily skin must have
reviews.comments: I received this in exchange for a honest review. [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I love me a good multifunctional product and this one from murad hits! It does all it says it will and more. This really does controls shine and mattifies the skin while still providing adequate uv protection. If you're an oily skin girly, this is a must have !

[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I absolutely LOVE this product! Since I have received it I gravitate towards using it everyday! I love the way it makes my skin feel- hydrated yet primed and not as shiny. I also really love the way the top is designed with the pump to the side and a easy grip push down. The packaging is slim and easy to travel with as well. I have noticed my skin to be less shiny and overall more matte as well. I am so happy to have received this product because I really do love it!!

faceoff_positive.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] Murad Superactive Moisturizer SPF 50 is an impressive product that combines hydration with sun protection, making it a vital addition to any skincare routine. This moisturizer is specifically designed for oily and combination skin, and its lightweight formula absorbs quickly without leaving a greasy residue. The SPF 50 offers excellent sun protection, shielding the skin from harmful UVA and UVB rays, which is crucial for preventing premature aging and skin damage.

One of the standout features is its matifying properties. It helps control shine throughout the day, making it perfect for those who struggle with excess oiliness. The inclusion of pore-control technology minimizes the appearance of pores, giving the skin a smoother, more refined look. Users often rave about how their skin feels immediately refreshed and revitalized after application.

The texture of the moisturizer is silky and smooth, which feels luxurious on the skin. It blends effortlessly, making it a great base for makeup. Many users appreciate that, unlike other sunscreens, it doesn't leave a white cast on the skin; instead, it provides a natural finish. The subtle, fresh scent is pleasant and not overpowering, adding to the overall enjoyable experience of using the product.

Murad's commitment to quality ingredients is evident, as the formula is enriched with antioxidants that help protect the skin from environmental stressors. It also hydrates without clogging pores, which is often a concern for those with oily skin. Users typically note that their skin feels more balanced and less prone to breakouts after incorporating this moisturizer into their routine.

The packaging is sleek and travel-friendly, making it easy to take on the go. While some may find the price point on the higher side, many agree the results are worth the investment. Overall, Murad Superactive Moisturizer SPF 50 with matifying oil and pore control is a remarkable product that delivers on its promises. It effectively hydrates, protects, and enhances the skin's appearance, making it a must-have for anyone looking to achieve a healthy, matte finish. This moisturizer has quickly become a staple in many skincare regimens, and it's easy to see why.
faceoff_positive.headline: The Best SPF ever!

faceoff_negative.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] It feels more like a soft, lightweight primer than a heavy sunscreen, which surprised me in a good way. When I apply it, it goes on smoothly, absorbs quickly, and gives my skin a nice matte finish without feeling dry or tight. I have combination skin, and this does a great job keeping the shine away throughout the day, especially in my T-zone area. My pores look more blurred when I wear it, and I notice my makeup applies better on top of it too. The scent in my opinion is subtle, but it's there. It smells clean and slightly herbal, kind of like a soft citrus and tea tree blend, but it fades quickly once it's on my skin. I like it, it makes the application feel more refreshing without being overpowering or like a strong perfume fragrance. The sunscreen didn't irritate my skin at all, which is always a plus for me with scented products. On really hot and humid days, I did notice a bit of shine peeking through by the afternoon, but nothing too bad and I still feel like my skin looks smoother than usual.
